sub_topic: Finding the area of a sector of a circle.
message_1: A circle has a radius of 10 cm. Find the area of the sector formed by a central angle of 60 degrees.
message_2:
To find the area of the sector formed by a central angle of 60 degrees, we can use the formula:

Area of sector = (Central angle / 360) × π × r²

where the central angle is 60 degrees and the radius (r) is 10 cm.

Area of sector = (60 / 360) × π × 10²

Area of sector = (1/6) × π × 100

Area of sector = 100π/6

Area of sector = 50π/3

The area of the sector formed by a central angle of 60 degrees is approximately 50π/3 square centimeters or approximately 52.36 square centimeters.
